content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a simple implementation of the problem in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks
    blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, 1))
    
    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks together with a newline
    code = reduce((a, b)->"$(a)\n$(b)", map(x->replace(x, "`" => ""), blocks), init="")
    
    return code
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all occurrences of the Julia code block in the markdown document. It then removes the code fences from each block and joins them together with a newline character. The `reduce` function is used to concatenate all the blocks into one string. 

Please note that this solution assumes that there are no nested code blocks, i.e., it does not handle cases where Julia code blocks are nested within other types of code blocks.
